intro: Phacelia magellanica f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phacelia, is a perennial flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators in its native environment.
